1.content:
It was late at night, you were driving home after a long day at the office. God, you hated the office. Sure it was a steady job that paid well enough, and wasn't too difficult. Add that to the raise you earned last month, and you got yourself a nice way to make a living.

Except that it's boring. Excruciatingly so. Every day it's the same thing. "Type this, hand it to Person A", "Edit this, hand it to Person B". You shouldn't be living like this! You're 22 for Christ's sake! You should be out doing something. This time should be spent having adventures, making friends along the way. Not being cooped up in a cubicle typing on a box to make letters show up on a slightly larger box! Of course you've told this to yourself many times, and it changes nothing. Nothing ever changes...

The road was dark and empty. It seems nobody else was out this late. You drove past the street lamps that cast a faint yellow glow on the road ahead. In the distance, there was another light. However this one was much brighter than any street lamp. It was almost as bright as the sun itself, except the sun glows in shades of yellow. This light was shining white.

The light intensified to the point where you could no longer keep your eyes open. You slammed on the brakes, stopping your car and strained to see what was ahead. However once you opened your eyes again, your heard a faint humming and everything went black...


You wake up later in....
1.title: The Light

choices: You see a person laying a few feet away
You notice that you have changed!
11.content: You wake up, and you can see trees above you. 'How did I end up here?' You thought as you sat up. There seems to be no civilization anywhere around here, just trees in all directions! You stand up, and that's when you notice something.
11.title: A Forest

111.content: What type of animal was it?
111.title: A animal is watching you

113.content:
“Shit,” you mutter to yourself, “shit, shit, shit, shit, shit, FUCK!” you compose yourself, and decide to assess the situation. You were driving home, you saw a blinding light, and now you’re in the forest with a stranger.
You notice that the stranger appears to resemble a lamia of some sort, with greenish scales, and an intricate criss-cross design on it’s back. The underbelly of this beast is a pale-yellow. The lamia, at first human-looking, is actually covered in scales. The scales have been torn in some places, with deep gashes. The gashes appear to be fresh, as some are still bleeding. The most remarkable aspect of this lamia is that it’s tail is squirming, as if someone is struggling to get out.
The lamia appears to be asleep, so you walk toward it. Creeping up, your hand falls to the pocket knife in your pocket. You ponder what to do, and eventually decide to...
113.title: You see a person laying a few feet away

choices: She digests you, but your soul overpowers hers, and you take control of her body
She told the truth, and you arrive to her village.
1131.content:
You visualize the cut you are about to make. But first, to make sure it doesn’t wake up while you’re cutting it, you slit it’s throat. The deed done, you start sawing away at the scaled belly of the lamia.
An hour later, you have finally got the lamia’s would-be prey out of the stomach. The person you freed is not actually a person, but a centaur! This centaur had the upper body of a young woman, about in her late teens. She had a gorgeous face with light blue eyes and elven ears. Her bosom was covered by 2 half-digested leaves. Her lower half, however resembled a deer, light brown and black. Once you pulll her free, she says to you, “ Oh, thank you, human, so much, you saved my life!”
You reply, “ Eh, it’s no big deal. It’s the right thing to do.”
“So, you’re a human, huh? How did you survive the raid on your village?”
“What attack?” You reply swiftly.
“You don’t know?! The attack that wiped out all humans, where they feasted upon you all for days, in the most sadistic way ever? They had competitions to see who could eat the most of you!”
“Actually, I don’t think I’m from anywhere nearby. You see, I was driving my car-“
“What’s this car you speak of?”
“A car? Really? You don’t know what that is? It’s a thing that you use to travel. They have pedals that you use to stop and go, and...” you explain what a car is to her, and answer all her questions.
“So,” she asks, “you come from a place with cars, and you were driving one, and you got blinded, which then made you wake up? And, in your world, humans are the only intelligent race?”
“That about sums it up.”
She then explains how the lamias were raiding and eating other races. She was taking a walk when she was attacked and eaten by the lamia, but not often a short fight. “You know what, I’m going to take you to my village. You can live there, and help us fight the lamia, and it’ll be great!”
“Sounds good, but how far away is this village?”
“About 20 km. We’ll get there in no time!”
“20 km! It’ll take us hours to get there, and the sun is already almost set!”
“You can ride me,” she suggests.
“That’ll just slow you down.”
“Oh, you know how lamia can swallow things whole? Well so can I!” She says proudly. “It’s actually a birth defect, but I think it’s a gift.”
“You want to eat me!?” You yell, bewildered.
“Don’t worry, us centaur have a storage stomach. I’ll put you in there, you’ll be unharmed, and I can go as fast as possible.”
You think about this. Do I really trust this random person I saved? Should I go off on my own? Should I just ride her? You eventually decide to ride in her stomach.
“Yay! Let’s get going then, shall we?” With that, she picks you up and stuffs you into her throat. The throat is tight and compressing. From the outside, you see your feet sliding down the centaur’s gullet. You hope you made the right decision, but you have no way of knowing. Meanwhile, your feet emerge in a larger chamber; her stomach. You wiggle your feet and she giggles. Soon, your entire body is in the tight confines of her throat. She starts to gallop, swaying her bulging belly to and fro. You feel everything moving around you.
“By the way, I never caught your name,” you say from inside her, not knowing if she can hear you.
“Ada,” she responds hastily.
Your future lies in Ada’s hands. What happened?
1131.title: Cut the lamia open

choices: West - Deeper Into The Grassy Field
Some Comes For You Before You Pick
12.content:
Long strands of green and gold grass flow like waves under the control of the wind. You are standing in a vast plain of wild nature untouched by man. There is no evidence how you got here and there is no evidence that anyone has been here before you. Except for the trampled grass beneath you, there are no trails or paths of broken blades to indicate that beast nor man has even entered this domain before. You are possibly the first to ever see this land and possible the only creature to be here are all. On top of that, there is no way for you to tell where you are. In short, you are lost in a place that seems to have been forgotten time - or at least the time of mankind's rapid development. There is something relaxing about that thought to you, as there are no people, there are to jobs, there are no bosses, and no desk. You are free from all that troubled you and now you can go on your grand adventure! There is just one problem: you have no survival skills which means your time here is not going to last unless you find supplies. So you head off to explore in hope of finding food, shelter, and water - after all that's what you need to survive - along with air-conditioning, clothes, wi-fi, and medicines. Everything a human needs to live or so you believe.

In what direction do you walk towards?
12.title: Untouched

125.content: How does it come for you?
125.title: Stalked

choices: You saw the same male face you always had.
You saw the same female face you always had.
Something pounces on you before you can see much.
Before you get a clear view, you pass out again.
14.content:
With a groan, you slowly returned to consciousness. Your head was pounding and your tongue felt like it was made of sandpaper. Behind your eyelids, you could tell there was a brilliant light. You briefly wondered where that light could possibly be coming from in your bedroom. After several moments, your foggy memory dredged up that late night drive and the odd light that had appeared in front of you. Holding your hand out in front of your face helped soften the light a bit, though you also felt a sprinkling of dust or something raining down on your face. Cracking your eyelids open, you saw that you weren’t in your car any longer, you weren’t even sitting down. You weren’t sure how, but you were now lying down and facing up into a brilliant blue sky with the sun blazing high overhead.

Your slow as molasses mind finally pieced together a thought, Have I really been unconscious all night?

Your muscles felt worn and strained, but you managed to turn your head slightly and saw that your car wasn’t even in sight. Instead, a pristine white beach spread out in either direction, bordered by a thick wall of vegetation towards your head and a gently lapping sea opposite the greenery. Sitting up was a chore but you eventually managed it.

Looking around, you kept thinking that there was no way you could have ended up a beach. You didn’t even live anywhere near a major body of water, let alone one like what was stretched out before you.

It has to be a hallucination you kept thinking. Though it’s a really good one at that you had to admit as you picked up a handful of sand and let it slip through your fingers.

It took far longer than it should have, but you eventually managed to half crawl down to the water. On hands and knees up to your elbows in the water, you felt how refreshingly cool it was. You hadn’t realized how almost painfully hot you had become lying there in the sun. Again, you were struck by how realistic everything felt in what had to be a hallucination, a dream, or whatever. Splashing some water down across the back of your neck, you watched as the water become almost mirror smooth beneath you.
14.title: Sun, sand, and surf

143.content: You couldn’t quite comprehend what you saw in what was supposed to be your reflection at first. Slowly, your mind started up again and you managed to place what was so different.
143.title: A new body for a new world

choices: You are definitely more vulpine than before.
You’ve taken on a completely different furred form.
1431.content:
There was no mistaking it, but it surely couldn’t be possible. And yet there it was: fur covering your face. Looking down, you wondered how you could have possibly missed the fur on your arm and hand as well.

The snap of a branch behind you made you spin around, any thoughts about your sudden fur shoved aside. An instant later, you regretted the sudden motion. Your head started to swim and your eyesight went out of focus. You thought you could make out a figure coming out of the greenery beyond the beach, but you couldn’t be sure. Your arms couldn’t support you any longer and you ended up falling back with a splash. The briny water closed around your head but you didn’t have the strength to force yourself back to the surface. A shadowy outline obscured the bright sky and seemed to be reaching down to you, but darkness closed around you again.

Bolting upright with a gasp, you fought against the water pushing down on you. It wasn’t for several seconds that you realized that you weren’t in the water anymore. You weren’t even on the beach anymore. Instead you were covered up in a rather luxurious bed, in an equally lavish looking bedroom. In short, it was nothing like your own bedroom.

Relaxing somewhat again, you took stock of yourself. Your head didn’t ache nearly as bad and your throat and mouth felt just as improved. The fur that had to have been a dream was still there, just as real feeling as the rest of this hallucination.

Slipping out of the bed, your legs were a little wobbly, but you were able to brace yourself against the wall. Looking down, you saw that your presumably soaked clothing had been removed, and now you were clad in a fuzzy robe. Forcing yourself on, you came to a mirror attached to the wall and got your first good view of yourself.
1431.title: The new furrier you

choices: …super curvy, if a bit plump, cow.
14311.content: It barely even take you a moment to make sense of your reflection now that you were in much better condition. Casting your eye down across your reflection you found that you had become a…
14311.title: One of the herd

143111.content:
Short yet thick black and white fur covered your whole body; a body that was decidedly much more curvy than before. You were surprised that you could stand with a pair of breasts that was each larger than your head. This may have been due to the counter balancing of a round and plush rump that wrapped into the thick thighs that supported you. Your stomach was a bit softer looking than before as well, but it was nowhere near as great a difference as what had happened above and below. A pair of curving horns rose above your longer ears, splitting the blood red locks that spilled from atop your head and reached almost to your derrière. Those waves had never been quite that long or that full looking either. Your attention was drawn away from your hair as you noticed a motion behind you. That’s when you noticed the long whip-like tail that sprouted from above your cheeks. Its tip sported a tuft of hair that was remarkably like that on your head. You also noted that you lacked an udder, and were somewhat thankful for that, though perhaps your much larger breasts made up for that absence.

You couldn’t believe it. This couldn’t be true, not at all. There was no way you were in some unknown location and so completely altered. And yet it felt so real, and nothing you did seemed to dispel any of this. No amount of pinching or slapping made you wake up safe and sound back in your car and in your own body.

The sound of a door easing open behind you drew you from your thoughts. Bright light streamed through the crack, but you could make out a silhouette peeking through the gap.

Then you heard a voice, “Oh, you’re awake already? That’s good.”

With that, the door was opened fully. You were momentarily blinded as light flooded into the room. You hadn’t realized how dim the light in here was. Blinking your eyes several times, you managed to start to see through the brightness and see who was speaking to you.
143111.title: A curvy cow

choices: “I saw a bit of what happened.”
“No, I was hoping you could tell me.”
1431111.content:
You gaped at the dragoness standing in the doorway. The light streaming around her made her black scales shine like little pieces of obsidian. This almost glow picked out her substantial curves, curves that gave her an hourglass figure like yourself, but not as exaggerated. A flowing dress hugged those curves, highlighting each and every one. She seemed unaware of your staring even as she walked up to you, a grin dimpling her cheeks.

“I was worried that I hadn’t gotten to you in time. Are you feeling alright?” she asked, her voice crisp and clear and almost musical in tone.

You started to respond, saying that you were a little woozy and worn out, but fine for the most part. You never got that far though, cut off as your stomach roared like a possessed beast. You put a hand on the wall again, supporting yourself as a wave of pain swept out. How in the world could you be that hungry?

“Ah, of course, you must be starving. Please, rest and I’ll be back as soon as I can with some food.” She helped you back into the bed before vanishing.

Despite yourself, you found your eyes glued to her curvy rump as she walked away. A rump highlighted by the long flowing tail swishing back and forth in time with her hips.

Sitting back in the bed, you tried to piece together what was happening. First, you encountered that strange light, then you woke up on a beach with no sign of your car or the road or anything, plus you somehow changed into an anthro cow with huge curves, and to cap it all off, you were under the care of an anthro dragoness. Your head swam, there didn’t seem to be any rhyme or reason to what you were experiencing.

Your stomach growled again. This time, you almost doubled over from the pain. As if summoned by the dreadful noise, the dragoness returned. You had been expecting a sandwich and some crisps or something. She returned with so much more though.

Ahead of her came a little cart, both shelves laden with platters of food. You could see a steak with a side of mashed potatoes, a mound of Linguine Alfredo, a steaming bowl filled with tomato soup, and more.

“No, no, this is too much,” you said while shaking your head, feeling the unfamiliar sensation of your ears flopping with the motion. Your voice was unfamiliar as well, and not only due to the dryness.

“Nonsense,” the dragoness said as she pulled the cart up beside the bed. “You need to eat. But I suppose whatever you don’t have can be kept for latter.”

You couldn’t find a hole in that logic, and your body didn’t seem to care either way. The smells drifting off of everything and floating to your nose stoked the fires of your already ravenous appetite. The dragoness sat down on the edge of the bed, her tail curving to lie down alongside your leg. Then she took the platter of pasta from the cart, wound some up on the fork, and presented the gooey mass to you. You bristled a bit at her feeding you like a baby, but relented as the feeling of weakness persisted.

The first taste proved divine, the melding flavors washing over your tongue and down your throat. The second and third proved as wonderful. Before you realized it, the whole bowl was clean except for a few gobs of sauce that remained. In a flash, the dragoness turned to the next plate, and the next, and so on.

You leaned back against the pillow, a burp escaping your lips. You had never eaten like that and felt so embarrassed. You could almost see the swell of your belly beyond the mountains of your breasts. The dragoness didn’t seem to mind at all; in fact the smile on her face said that she was pleased that you had eaten everything. Some worry filled your mind about the steak, was that too close to cannibalism for you? Once the first bit touched your tongue though, you didn’t care, the taste was too fantastic. You even drank down what had to be almost a gallon of some fruity soft drink or something. That one left you with a pleasant tickling in your throat, much better than the sandpaper feeling that you had before.

The dragoness started to take the cart back out, but you caught her hand. You were stunned for a moment about how nice it felt; warm and not at all leathery like you was thinking.

She paused, looking back to you with an arched brow. You paused as well, wondering if you should give word to your question or not.

The moment stretched on till you broke it by babbling, “Do you know what happened to me?”

You wished you could take it back as soon as you said it. No, it was absurd that she would know what happened to you. That was going to remain a mystery to you, you were sure. Then the dragoness opened her mouth.
1431111.title: The dragoness

choices: “For you to start your slave duties.”
14311111.content:
“Of course, I brought you here.”

The words hung in the air, almost as if you could see them, reach out and touch them. The dragoness said them as if you should have known them, her brow furrowing a bit in confusion. Then your hand slipped from hers and she was gone, leaving alone with her answer.

Your mind reeled. It was hard enough to understand what had happened to you, but to know that it was on purpose as well, it was the final straw. Your first response was one of anger. Somehow that creature had taken you away from your life and your world, because it was obvious that this was not the world you were used to. And to be changed like this…You stared down at your hand. The fur there was thinner and shorter, but still evident. You growled, balling your first and dropping it from view.

You continued to fume on this for some time, but before long the steam was petering out. How short a time ago were you complaining about your life, wishing for something different to happen, for something to change? You had never imagined anything like this, but didn’t it fit the bill? And as for the body…

You looked down over yourself, eyes tracing the swell of your bust and the curves of your legs beyond. You lifted your arm again, flexing the long dexterous fingers before running the other hand up and down the arm, feeling the slight tickle of the fur. This body was strange to say the least, but it also resonated with some part of your brain.

You were unwilling to accept all this yet, and you were still more than a little displeased at having no say in the matter. On the other hand though, you had a second chance here, a new life away from the monotony of the old one. You could perhaps learn to enjoy this new form and the life you could make here. The fact that the dragoness was rather pleasing to the eye – even if as strange and otherworldly as your own body had become – was another benefit as well.

The dragoness swept back in, her head tipped to one side and chewing on her lip. “You really didn’t know?” The look of confusion on your face must have been very obvious, as she continued, “You really didn’t know that I brought you here?” You shook your head. “Strange,” she went on, “it wasn’t supposed to work that way. Perhaps I made a mistake…” she rubbed her face as her voice trailed off. “No, you’re here, and we can deal with the rest as you get settled.” Then she looked up at you again, “Once you feel better, we can start getting ready.”

“Ready?” you repeated, “Ready for what?”
14311111.title: The beginning of acceptance

1431113.content: You rub your eyes to remove more of the blindness seeing that the speaker was a
1431113.title: S/he is something else entirely.

1432.content: What the hell? You think to yourself. You blink once. Twice. The same face is there. You stick out your tongue. You’re shocked to see that it’s forked. The face in the water is also sticking it’s tongue out. It copies whatever you do. It looks nothing like you, and yet it has to be you. You turn over to find you are...
1432.title: You’re covered in scales.

choices: Hide away, and eat only when necessary
14321.content:
You pass out.
Regaining consciousness, you see it is now night time. You look up at the stars. You see them perfectly. You turn the attention back to yourself. It’s you, but you’re scaled. You run a hand down your body, feeling your familiar curves. You’re clothes haven’t changed, save for a hole in your dress for a long, spiny tail. You slip out of consciousness as your stomach rumbles.
You wake up the next day. Your iridescent scales reflect the sunlight beautifully. You need to eat and drink, badly. As you look back upon the water, you notice how tiny the waves are. They are hardly a cm tall, and if you put your heel where the water turned to sand, the waves are at your ankle.
You gather your strength, and walk down the beach in search of life. You come across a small camp, and decide to hide behind some tiny trees. You wait, and see that a group of tiny people cooking a tiny woman on a spit arrive. You take action, springing from the trees, and snatching all the tiny men. You hold them over your mouth before dropping them into your stomach. From the outside, it appears nothing is in your stomach. You rub your belly and give it a few pats, before looking back at the woman.
She was dead before the teeny men arrived, so you add her to the group of people in you. As you digest them, you realize that you’re a giant! You also get a feeling this isn’t your world. Do you eat anything you can, or spare people’s lives by eating as little as possible?
14321.title: You, but reptilian

15.content: Your body was sprawled on a cold floor when your vision returned. The air tasted stale, old, almost stagnate as you try to stand up in a dim light. On shaking legs you make your way to a door but collapse onto the floor in front of it. You muscle a dry swallow as you look at the door wondering what's on the other side. Your question is soon answered as it slowly opens seemingly on its own. Light pours into your small room, once more blinding you as your eyes adjust to the brightness. Slowly you realize you're in a...
15.title: Structures

choices: The earthlings see you all for the first time.
Your enemies arrive on Planet Earth.
151.content:
As you notice everything's gigantic including your room itself as you start stomping out of your room over to where the spaceship's main area is as a few of your gigantic fat animated anthropomorphic animal crew mates noticed you were up and moving around as well.

"I see you're up and moving around as well." Cooler one of the gigantic fat animated anthropomorphic animals said.

"Yes I'm up and moving around but why am I here on this gigantic spaceship and where are we heading to?" You asked.

"You see you're on this gigantic spaceship to lead us since you are our leader and as for where we're heading to I believe it's Planet Earth we're heading to, as we're on our way there to help defend that planet from some evil aliens who apparently are our enemies and also are gigantic fat animated anthropomorphic animals as well as they're gonna try to take over that planet unless we can save the day and beat back those evil aliens as well." One of your three gigantic anthropomorphic animal crew mates in other words part of a trio of poodles explained to you.

"Wait a minute they're going to take over Planet Earth? But that's my original home world where I was from." You said.

"You say your original home world where you were from was planet Earth? None of us ever knew that until now." One of your crew mates said.

"I do hate to interrupt this fascinating conversation, but we have now arrived here on Planet Earth before our enemies arrive." One of your other crew mates said.

"Well everyone I guess it's time to set foot here on Planet Earth and try to make a good impression while we're at it." You said as the gigantic spaceship's doors opened as you all start stomping your way outside.

At that precise moment....
151.title: Spaceship

info.brief_description: After seeing a blinding light, you wake up in a strange new land with strange creatures.
info.description:
You see a blinding light, and the next thing you know, you wake up in a mysterious new place. What creatures inhabit this new land? What will they do? Is there any way back home?

Here are some rules:

- Be descriptive
- No one line entries (With a few exceptions)
- If you have to ask "Is this appropriate to add?" Chances are it probably is. Go for it.
- Sex and/or other adult content is encouraged.
- Furries and/or Anthros are encouraged.
- Giants and/or Miniatures are encouraged.
- Don't be nervous about writing an entry. If you want a character to be vored a certain way, then go for it. Or send me a message and I'll see what I can do.
